pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1b57e93447](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20502/commits/1b57e93447331559a98d28c6af8c13f90f9e47a2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.IsGLB.isPredLimit_of_not_mem`
`+ _root_.IsGLB.isPredPrelimit_of_not_mem`
`+ _root_.IsGLB.mem_of_not_isPredLimit`
`+ _root_.IsGLB.mem_of_not_isPredPrelimit`
`+ _root_.IsLUB.isSuccLimit_of_not_mem`
`+ _root_.IsLUB.isSuccPrelimit_of_not_mem`
`+ _root_.IsLUB.mem_of_not_isSuccLimit`
`+ _root_.IsLUB.mem_of_not_isSuccPrelimit`
`- IsGLB.mem_of_not_isPredLimit`
`- IsGLB.mem_of_not_isPredPrelimit`
`- IsLUB.mem_of_not_isSuccLimit`
`- IsLUB.mem_of_not_isSuccPrelimit`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Why can't we have both the old and new versions?

I wouldn't mind having both versions, but @b-mehta told me not too long ago that this sort of duplication (where one theorem is just the contrapositive of the other) should be avoided as it just ends up bloating the library.
But it's not contraposite here! Anyway, please undeprecate

Maybe it's not the strict contrapositive in an intuitionistic sense, but one of the theorems has the form `Â¬ A â†’ B` and the other one has the form `Â¬ B â†’ A`.

Thinking about this a bit more. If we keep the old `IsLUB.mem_of_not_isSuccPrelimit`, does that mean we also need `IsLUB.mem_of_not_isSuccLimit`? And the dual forms too? That's eight theorems we would now have when we could do with four.

I don't we need to duplicate lemmas between `IsSuccLimit` and `IsSuccPrelimit`. It's easy enough to get one from the other. To go from `Â¬ A â†’ B` to `Â¬ B â†’ A` is more complicated, since one needs to use the rather obscure `not_imp_comm` or some more complicated tactic manipulation.

The `IsSuccLimit` and `IsSuccPrelimit` versions of this lemma have distinct hypotheses and one is not trivial from the other; though other lemmas in this file are straightforward duplications, some of which are convenient, some of which should get addressed in the future.

Also, there is a single tactic which can go from `Â¬ A â†’ B` to `Â¬ B â†’ A`, which is `by_contra!`.
Alright, I've added all of the contrapositive versions.
@YaelDillies Do you think this is ready to go now?
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks!

maintainer merge

pullRequest.title: feat: generalize `IsLUB.mem_of_not_isSuccPrelimit` to `LinearOrder`
